metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HBSS console tabbed browsing is disabled
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) Ensure that the browser used with the ePO console has tabbed browsing disabled. In the Registry Editor, navigate to the following registry key: Registry Hive: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Subkey: SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\TabbedBrowsing Value Name: Enabled Data Type: REG_DWORD Value Data: 00000000 If the Value Data is not set to ‘00000000,’ this is a finding.

criterion.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\TabbedBrowsing!Enabled type equals reg_dword and value equals 00000000

metadata.title: (U) The ePO server has the user timeout parameter set properly
metadata.description: (U) Open the ‘?: program files\mcafee\epolicy orchestrator\server\conf\web.xml file.’ (’?’ Indicates drive letter.) Examine the session-timeout parameter and ensure that it is set at 15 or less. If it is set to greater than 15, this is a finding. Note: The effectiveness of this parameter needs to be correlated to the dashboard refresh rate. The dashboard refresh rate should be set to a parameter greater than the session timeout parameter. Note: If the console is being used as part of an operations center type environment, requiring continuous, real-time screen display (which requires a lower rate), the following needs to be documented with the IAO: -The logon session does not have administrator rights. -The display station (i.e., keyboard, CRT, etc.) is located in a controlled access area.

criterion.comment: Session timeout matches the pattern ^([0-9]|1[0-5])$

metadata.title: (U) The HBSS keystore permissions are set correctly
metadata.description: (U) From Windows explorer, find the ?:\Program Files\McAfee\ePolicy Orchestrator\keystore directory (? is the drive letter). Examine the permissions on the directory. Only administrators and system should be able to update or write into this directory. If any other user can update or write into this directory, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: No one but the Administrators group and the SYSTEM user can write to the Keystore directory

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The ePO SQL database installation is dedicated to HBSS.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the SQL Server Management Studio: Locate the SQL server used for ePO. Expand the databases folder. The following databases should exist: ePO4_{MachineName} master model msdb tempdb If any other databases exist, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Count of databases unrelated to HBSS or SQL Server equals 0

metadata.title: (U) SA account is not used within the application.
metadata.description: (U) Using a browser, navigate to https://localhost/core/config or https://eponame/core/config. Logon. Examine the User Name field. If the user name is SA, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: SQL Server database account does not match the pattern ^[Ss][Aa]$

metadata.title: (U)HBSS has the current security patches installed.
metadata.description: (U) For the ePO server, determine the current patch level by clicking on Help, and then, selecting About ePolicy Orchestrator. If the value is less than 4.5.1.851, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: ePO version is greater than or equal to 4.5.1.851

metadata.title: (U) The ePO server is not using the default keys.
metadata.description: (U) Ensure that the default keys have been replaced on the ePO server. There are two methods to determine this finding. 1. From the ePO server console, select the ‘Configuration’ tab, then select ‘the Server Settings’ tab. Select the ‘Console Security Keys' category. Ensure that the legacy key 'HMW9L9yM2AbJY8qrvmNCNJpYXAI=' does not exist. Note: The character before the second = sign is a capital letter I, as in India. 2. From the SQL Server Management Studio: Ensure that the database pull-down has the ePO server database. Execute the following command by typing the command into the query window and then clicking on the ‘Execute’ button: Select NodeName, AgentGUID from epoLeafNode where ServerKeyHash ='HMW9L9yM2AbJY8qrvmNCNJpYXAI=' Note: The character before the second = sign is a capital letter I, as in India. Finding Determination: Determine if the ePO server is listed within these results. If the ePO server is listed from this query, this is a finding. Note: A typo in the query may result in a false negative. An error message may indicate that the wrong database is selected. Note: After fixing this finding, all affected ePO clients will need to have the client software reinstalled. This should be done before deployment to avoid duplication of work.

criterion.comment: Count of default agent-server communication keys equals 0
Count of default agent-server communication keys used by the ePO server equals 0

metadata.title: (U) The ePO server has all clients using non-default keys.
metadata.description: (U) Verify that no serviced clients are using the default key. This procedure will be run at least weekly. From the SQL Server Management Studio: Ensure that the database pull-down has the ePO server database. Execute the following command by typing the command into the query window and clicking on the ‘Execute’ button: Select NodeName, AgentGUID from epoLeafNode where ServerKeyHash ='HMW9L9yM2AbJY8qrvmNCNJpYXAI=' Note: The character before the second ‘=’ sign is a capital letter I, as in India. If there are records returned from this query, this is a finding. If the SA (or the DBA) is not running this process at least weekly, this is a finding. Note: The procedures for removing the default keys are detailed in the HBSS Configuration Guide. Note: A typo in the query may result in a false negative. An error message may indicate that the wrong database is selected.

criterion.comment: Count of default agent-server communication keys equals 0
Count of default agent-server communication keys used by any system equals 0

metadata.title: (U) The ePO server has MyAverts disabled.
metadata.description: (U) From the ePO server console, select the ‘Configuration’ option, followed by the ‘Server Setting’ tab, then select the ‘MyAverts Security Threats’. Ensure that the ‘Updating’ parameter is set to disabled. If the updating parameter is not set to disabled, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: MyAvert Security Threats updating status is disabled

metadata.title: (U) ePO accounts are not configured with shared Windows accounts.
metadata.description: (U) From SQL Server Management Studio: Ensure that the database pull-down has the ePO server database. Execute the following command by typing the command into the query window and then clicking on the ‘Execute’ button: Select count(name), AuthURI from dbo.orionusers where authURI like ‘auth:ntlm%’ group by AuthURI If any resulting AuthURI has a corresponding number other than ‘1’, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Count of ePO accounts assigned to each AuthURI that uses Windows authentication equals 1

metadata.title: (U) HBSS Client Authentication Module is enabled.
metadata.description: (U) From the ePO server console, select the ‘Configuration’ menu option, then select the ‘Server Settings’ tab. Select the ‘Console Certificates’ category. Ensure ‘Client Authentication’ is set to ‘Enabled’. If ‘Client Authentication’ is not set to ‘Enabled’, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Client authentication status is enabled

metadata.title: (U) HBSS Client Authentication is set to current version.
metadata.description: (U) From the ePO server console, select the ‘Software' menu option, then select the ‘Extensions’ tab. Under ‘McAfee’, select ‘ePolicy Orchestrator’. Examine the ‘Certificate Authentication’ extension’s version number. If the version is not at least 4.5.1.6, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Versions of all installed Certificate Authentication extensions are greater than or equal to 4.5.1.6

metadata.title: (U) Limit number of non-PK enabled accounts.
metadata.description: (U) From SQL Server Management Studio: Ensure that the database pull-down has the ePO server database. Execute the following command by typing the command into the query window and then clicking on the ‘Execute’ button: Select name, AuthURI from dbo.orionusers where authURI not like ‘auth:cert%’ Finding Determination: If there are more than two userids listed, this is finding.

criterion.comment: Count of non-PK enabled accounts is less than or equal to 2

metadata.title: (U) OCSP Responder URL configured.
metadata.description: (U) From the ePO server console, select the ‘Configuration’ menu option, then select ‘Server Settings’ tab. Select the ‘Console Certificates’ category. Click the Edit button. Ensure the OCSP responder URL is populated with http://ocsp.disa.mil (or an appropriate .mil CRL for the location). If it is not populated correctly, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: OCSP Responder URL matches the pattern ^.*\.[Mm][Ii][Ll].*$

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) Port used for Console-to-Server communication is set correctly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO server console, select the ‘Configuration’ menu option, then select the ‘Server Settings’ tab. Select the ‘Console Certificates’ category. Click the Edit button. If the Console-to-Server port is not set to ‘8007’, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Console-to-Server Port equals 8007

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) SSL in use for SQL Server.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From SQL Server Configuration Manager, expand SQL Server Network Configuration, and right-click the protocols for the ePO server. Click Properties. From the Flags tab, ensure that the Force Encryption Parameter is set to Yes. If it is not set to Yes, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft SQL Server\_Instance_ID_\MSSQLServer\SuperSocketNetLib!ForceEncryption equals 1

metadata.title: (U) Agent-to-server communication port is set correctly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO interface, select the Configuration option, then select the Server Settings option. Select the Ports option. Ensure the Agent-to-server communication is set to 80. If this is not set to 80, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Agent-to-Server communication ports equal 80

metadata.title: (U) Agent-to-server communication secure port is set correctly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO interface, select the Configuration option, then select the server settings option. Select the Ports option. Ensure the Agent-to-server communication secure is set to 443. If this is not set to 443, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Agent-to-Server communication secure ports equal 443

metadata.title: (U) Agent wake-up communication port set correctly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO interface, select the Configuration option, then select the server settings option. Select the Ports option. Ensure the Agent wakeup communication is set to 591. If this is not set to 591, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Agent wake-up communication ports equal 591

metadata.title: (U) Agent broadcast port is set correctly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO interface, select the Configuration option, then select the server settings option. Select the Ports option. Ensure the Agent broadcast is set to 8082. If this is not set to 8082, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Agent broadcast ports equal 8082

metadata.title: (U) Console-to-application server communication port is set correctly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO interface, select the Configuration option, then select the server settings option. Select the Ports option. Ensure the Console-to-application server communication is set to 8005. If this is not set to 8005, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Console-to-application server communication ports equal 8005

metadata.title: (U) Client-to-server authenticated communication port is set correctly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO interface, select the Configuration option, then select the server settings option. Select the Ports option. Ensure the Client-to-server authenticated communication is set to 8443. If this is not set to 8443, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Client-to-server authenticated communication ports equal 8443

metadata.title: (U) The SQL database connection account is configured as least privilege.
metadata.description: (U) Using a browser, navigate to https://localhost/core/config or https://eponame/core/config. Logon. Note the User Name field. Through the SQL Server Management Studio, verify that the accounts being used are not part of the 'System Administrators' server role. If the account is part of the System Administrators role, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: ePO SQL Server account does not have SQL Server sysadmin role membership

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HIPS policy for Medium Severity is set properly.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) This check needs to be checked for the active policy that controls the ePO server. From the ePO server console, select the asset to be checked, then select ‘Policies,’ followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7:IPS’ from the product list. From the ‘IPS Protection’ category, select the applicable policy. From the 'Reaction Based on signature protection level' section, ensure that for the Severity level of ‘Medium,’ the reaction is set to at least the level of ‘Log.’ If it is not set to ‘Log’ (recommended) or ‘Prevent,’ this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Setting 'ReactionForMedium' for the HIPS IPS Protection policy that controls the ePO server equals 2 (Log)
Setting 'ReactionForMedium' for the HIPS IPS Protection policy that controls the ePO server equals 3 (Prevent)

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HIPS policy includes the signature for protection of the ePO Server KeyStore.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) This check needs to be checked for the active policy that controls the ePO server. From the ePO server console, then select the asset to be checked, select ‘Policies’, followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7:IPS’ from the product list. From the ‘IPS Rules’ category, select the applicable policy. From the ‘IPS Rules,’ select the ‘Signatures’ tab. Ensure that the signature of ‘Protect ePO Server Console Keystore’ is present. In addition to the signature being present, ‘Severity’ must be ‘high,’ ‘Log Status’ must be ‘enabled,’ and ‘Allow client rules’ must be ‘disabled.’ If the signature is not present or the properties are set incorrectly, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Settings exist for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Console Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server
Setting 'ModSeverityLevel' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Console Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 4 (High)
Setting 'ModLogStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Console Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 1 (Enabled)
Setting 'ModCreateLocalExStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Console Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 0 (Disabled)

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HIPS policy includes the signature for protection of Server.ini.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO server console, select the asset to be checked, then select ‘Policies’, followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7:IPS’ from the product list. From the ‘IPS Rules’ category, select the applicable policy. From the ‘IPS Rules,’ select the ‘Signatures’ tab. Ensure that the signature of ‘Protect ePO Server.ini’ is present. In addition to the signature being present, ‘Severity’ must be ‘high,’ ‘Log Status’ must be ‘enabled,’ and ‘Allow client rules’ must be ‘disabled.’ If the signature is not present or the properties are set incorrectly, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Settings exist for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server.ini' for the policy that controls the ePO server
Setting 'ModSeverityLevel' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server.ini' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 4 (High)
Setting 'ModLogStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server.ini' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 1 (Enabled)
Setting 'ModCreateLocalExStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server.ini' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 0 (Disabled)

metadata.title: (U) The HIPS for the ePO server has the firewall installed and enabled.
metadata.description: (U) From the ePO server console, select the asset to be checked, then select ‘Policies’, followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7: Firewall’ from the product list. From the ‘Firewall Options’ category, select the applicable policy. From the ‘Firewall Options’ section, ensure the ‘Enable Firewall’ option is checked. If the ‘Enabled Firewall’ option is not checked, this is a finding. Severity Determination: If H20200: HBSS Specific Perimeter Defense is a finding, this is a CAT I finding.

criterion.comment: Setting 'FWStatus' for HIPS Firewall Options policies equals 1 (Enabled)

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HIPS for the ePO server has the firewall set for regular protection.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO server console, select the asset to be checked, then select ‘Policies’, followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7:Firewall’ from the product list. From the ‘Firewall Options’ category, select the applicable policy. From the Firewall Options Section, ensure the ‘Regular protection’ option is checked. If the ‘Regular protection’ is not checked, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Setting 'AuditModeStatus' for HIPS Firewall Options policies equals 0
Setting 'InLearnModeStatus' for HIPS Firewall Options policies equals 0
Setting 'OutLearnModeStatus' for HIPS Firewall Options policies equals 0

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HIPS for the ePO server has the firewall set to not retain client rules.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO server console, select the asset to be checked, then select ‘Policies’, followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7: Firewall’ from the product list. From the ‘Firewall Options category,’ select the applicable policy. From the ‘Client rules’ section, ensure the ‘Retain existing Client Rules when this policy is enforced’ option is not checked. If the ‘Retain existing Client Rules when this policy is enforced’ is checked, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Setting 'MergeRules' for HIPS Firewall Options policies equals 0

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HIPS policy includes the signature for protection of ePO Server Agent Keystore.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO server console, select the asset to be checked, then select ‘Policies’, followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7:IPS’ from the product list. From the ‘IPS Rules’ category, select the applicable policy. From the ‘IPS Rules,’ select the ‘Signatures’ tab. Ensure that the signature of ‘Protect ePO Server Agent Keystore’ is present. In addition to the signature being present, ‘Severity’ must be ‘high,’ ‘Log Status’ must be ‘enabled,’ and ‘Allow client rules’ must be ‘disabled.’ If the signature is not present or the properties are set incorrectly, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Settings exist for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Agent Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server
Setting 'ModSeverityLevel' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Agent Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 4 (High)
Setting 'ModLogStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Agent Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 1 (Enabled)
Setting 'ModCreateLocalExStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect ePO Server Agent Keystore' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 0 (Disabled)

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HIPS policy includes the signature for protection of Protect Product Folders.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO server console, select the asset to be checked, then select ‘Policies’, followed by ‘Host Intrusion Prevention 7:IPS’ from the product list. From the ‘IPS Rules’ category, select the applicable policy. From the ‘IPS Rules,’ select the ‘Signatures’ tab. Ensure that the signature of ‘Protect Product Folders’ is present. In addition to the signature being present, ‘Severity’ must be ‘high,’ ‘Log Status’ must be ‘enabled,’ and ‘Allow client rules’ must be ‘disabled.’ If the signature is not present or the properties are set incorrectly, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Settings exist for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect Product Folders' for the policy that controls the ePO server
Setting 'ModSeverityLevel' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect Product Folders' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 4 (High)
Setting 'ModLogStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect Product Folders' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 1 (Enabled)
Setting 'ModCreateLocalExStatus' for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect Product Folders' for the policy that controls the ePO server equals 0 (Disabled)

metadata.title: (U//FOUO) The HBSS does not have vendor site supplied data dashboards in use.
metadata.description: (U//FOUO) From the ePO server console, select the ‘Dashboard’ tab, then select the ‘Manage Dashboards’ option. Ensure that there are no dashboards using any item from the categories of ‘McAfee Links’ or ‘MyAvert Web Service.’ If any dashboards exist using items from either of those categories, this is a finding.

criterion.comment: Number of times 'McAfee Links' or 'MyAvert Web Service' dashboards are used equals 0

registry_test.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\TabbedBrowsing!Enabled type equals reg_dword and value equals 00000000

fileeffectiverights53_test.comment: No one but the Administrators group and the SYSTEM user can write to the Keystore directory

sql57_test.comment: Count of databases unrelated to HBSS or SQL Server equals 0

variable_test.comment: SQL Server database account does not match the pattern ^[Ss][Aa]$

textfilecontent54_test.comment: ePO version is greater than or equal to 4.5.1.851

sql57_test.comment: Count of default agent-server communication keys equals 0
Count of default agent-server communication keys used by the ePO server equals 0
Count of default agent-server communication keys used by any system equals 0
MyAvert Security Threats updating status is disabled
Count of ePO accounts assigned to each AuthURI that uses Windows authentication equals 1
Versions of all installed Certificate Authentication extensions are greater than or equal to 4.5.1.6
Count of non-PK enabled accounts is less than or equal to 2

textfilecontent54_test.comment: OCSP Responder URL matches the pattern ^.*\.[Mm][Ii][Ll].*$

variable_test.comment: ePO uses a default SQL Server instance
ePO uses a named SQL Server instance

Settings exist for the HIPS IPS Rules signature 'Protect Product Folders' for the policy that controls the ePO server

The file effective rights on the Keystore directory for every user/group
The file effective rights on the Keystore directory for the SYSTEM user
The file effective rights on the Keystore directory for the Administrators group

local_variable.comment: SQL Server database account
ePO database name
SQL Server name
Raw SQL Server instance name used by ePO (this will be blank if the default SQL Server instance is used)
DBMS connection string that connects to the SQL Server instance used by ePO
SQL query that returns the count of databases unrelated to HBSS or SQL Server

concat.literal_component: SELECT COUNT(*) AS 'count' FROM master.sys.databases WHERE name NOT IN ('master', 'model', 'msdb', 'tempdb', '

local_variable.comment: Hostname of the local system (the ePO server) - registry_object method
SQL query that returns the count of default agent-server communication keys
SQL query that returns the count of default agent-server communication keys used by the ePO server
SQL query that returns the count of default agent-server communication keys used by any system
SQL query that returns the MyAvert Security Threats updating status
SQL query that returns AuthURIs that use Windows authentication and the count of ePO accounts assigned to each AuthURI

concat.literal_component: ].dbo.OrionUsers WHERE AuthURI LIKE 'auth:ntlm%' GROUP BY AuthURI

local_variable.comment: SQL query that returns the versions of all installed Certificate Authentication extensions

SQL query that returns a value of 1 or more if the ePO SQL Server account has SQL Server sysadmin role membership, 0 otherwise

concat.literal_component: SELECT COUNT(sp.name) AS 'count' FROM master.sys.server_role_members srm, master.sys.server_principals sp WHERE srm.role_principal_id = SUSER_ID('sysadmin') AND srm.member_principal_id = sp.principal_id AND (sp.name = '
